meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Ex-G.M. Executive Indicted A former executive has been indicted on charges of defrauding General Motors by taking documents with him when he jumped to Volkswagen in 1993. PAGE C1
Ex-G.M. Executive Indicted A former executive has been indicted on charges of defrauding General Motors by taking documents with him when he jumped to Volkswagen in 1993. PAGE C1
New Rules for Western Wall The Israeli Supreme Court ruled that women may now hold group prayer services at the Western Wall in Jerusalem. PAGE A6
Harvard President to Resign The president of Harvard University, Neil L. Rudenstine, who led a record-setting fund-raising campaign, is stepping down. PAGE A20
Jazz With a View Concert halls and a dance floor with a 50-foot window on Central Park will be the new face of Jazz at Lincoln Center. THE ARTS, PAGE E1
Devils Stay Alive New Jersey scored a 4-1 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers and trails its playoff series by 3 games to 2. SPORTSTUESDAY, PAGE D1
Trail Blazers Get Even Portland defeated the Los Angeles Lakers, 106-77, to even the Western Conference finals at a game apiece. SPORTSTUESDAY, PAGE D3
